page.title: 09RYDE MARINE TREATMENT SCHEME
page.content: Ryde and Seaview are both{seaside {resorts}with sandy beaches. They have a problem with{polluted bathing water because of the old sewage system. The bathing area does not comply with E.E.C. standards. The Southern Water Authority is starting a{new marine {treatment scheme}that will safely dispose of sewage from the Binstead, Ryde and Seaview areas. They are building a{headworks in Appley Park with a{3 km pipe}to take the sewage to the middle of the Solent. The pipe is being laid in a trench 20m below the surface. The scheme will cost over Â£6 m and will be completed during 1987. Because Appley Park is an amenity area, care is being taken to make the site as pleasant as possible. Most of the site will be underground and surface buildings will be landscaped.
